p: This finding suggests that the max number of days that Italian provincial capitals can exceed per year the limits set for PM 10 (particulate matter 10 μm or less in diameter) or for ozone, considering the meteorological conditions, is about 48 days ( Fig. 2 ). Beyond this critical point, the analytical and geometrical output suggests that environmental inconsistencies, because of the combination between air pollution and meteorological conditions, trigger a take-off of viral infectivity (epidemic diffusion) with damages for health of population, economy and society.
